Why do some people place their nose gear backwards?

Edited June 13, 2013 by Rockhem

They do it to prevent the aircraft from veering to any direction during takeoff. Also for aesthetics sometimes.

EDIT: I thought nose cones, sorry

Edited June 13, 2013 by Flixxbeatz
I do it to keep my space planes from nosing over on braking. Just gets that extra bit of forward support.

Like Markus Reese said, for forward support is one good reason. I also place them that way under the Mk1 Cockpit if I want the craft to sit a bit lower to the ground, usually for small aircraft and spaceplanes. Those craft also tend to need a longer wheel base, and turning the front gear backwards can help accomplish that.

Why do some people place their nose gear backwards?

Why is the sky blue, or the grass green? Why not?
Ok thanks, it puzzled me why people did that!
